debug_flag.label: Debug
debug_flag.tooltip: This will log requests and responses in /var/log/ops.log
debug_flag.comment: Make sure the global Magento logging is also enabled.

pspid.label: PSPID
pspid.comment: PSPID is a case sensitive field

secret_key_type.label: Hash algorithm
secret_key_type.tooltip: This must be identical to the value in the Ingenico ePayments backend in section Technical information on tab Global security parameters.

secret_key_in.label: SHA-IN Pass phrase
secret_key_in.comment: Only alphanumeric characters, not longer than 20 characters. Refer to Ingenico ePayments's backend in section Technical Information on tab Data and origin verification.
secret_key_in.tooltip: This must be identical to the value in the Ingenico ePayments backend in section Technical information on tab Data and origin verification.

secret_key_out.label: SHA-OUT Pass phrase
secret_key_out.comment: Only alphanumeric characters, not longer than 20 characters. Refer to Ingenico ePayments's backend in section Technical Information on tab Transaction feedback.
secret_key_out.tooltip: This must be identical to the value in the Ingenico ePayments backend in section Technical information on tab Transaction feedback.

mode.label: Mode
mode.tooltip: Depending on the selection the extension will communicate with the Ingenico ePayments test or production service. Choose custom, if you have to use special urls for the gateway.
mode.comment: Please note that, after changing this value, you might also need to update additional fields like API-User and password, PSPID or SHA-IN/OUT pass phrase.

api_userid.label: API User
api_userid.tooltip: Special user for API must be created in the Ingenico ePayments backend in section Users.

api_pswd.label: API Password
api_pswd.tooltip: Password which has been set in the Ingenico ePayments backend for above API user.

payment_action.label: Payment Action
payment_action.tooltip: This setting will override the configuration in the Ingenico ePayments backend in section Technical information on tab Global transaction parameters.

template.label: Payment Template
template.tooltip: For an easier PCI compliance we recommend redirect mode, iFrame mode or dynamic template with the template hosted on Ingenico ePayments servers. This does NOT affect the Hosted Tokenization iFrame (HTP).

template_identifier.label: Template Identifier/Url
template_identifier.tooltip: Enter the TemplateRootId you received from Ingenico ePayments or the url to an external template.

html_title.label: Title of the Ingenico ePayments Template

bgcolor.label: Background Color of Ingenico ePayments Template

txtcolor.label: Text Color of the Ingenico ePayments Template

tblbgcolor.label: Table Background Color of the Ingenico ePayments Template

tbltxtcolor.label: Table Text Color of the Ingenico ePayments Template

buttonbgcolor.label: Button Background Color of the Ingenico ePayments Template

buttontxtcolor.label: Button Text Color of the Ingenico ePayments Template

fonttype.label: Font Family of the Ingenico ePayments Template

logo.label: Logo of the Ingenico ePayments Template
logo.comment: URL/filename of the logo. The URL must be absolute and stored on a secure server.

pmlist.label: Layout of Payment Methods
pmlist.tooltip: Layout on the external payment page (for redirect payment methods).

redirectOrderReference.label: Order reference in case of redirect payments
redirectOrderReference.comment: See chapter 'Configuration', section 'Magento - Backend' in the documentation. Please note that the option 'orderId' is not used for the Kwixo payment methods.

inlineOrderReference.label: Order reference in case of inline payments
inlineOrderReference.comment: See chapter 'Configuration', section 'Magento - Backend' in the documentation.

showQuoteIdInOrderGrid.label: Show Quote ID in the order grid

submitExtraParameters.label: Submit extra parameters
submitExtraParameters.tooltip: Only enable this if you wish to use Fraud Detection.
submitExtraParameters.comment: Enable this if you wish to use fraud detection

resendPaymentInfo_template.label: Resend payment information template
resendPaymentInfo_template.tooltip: The email template to use. Choose 'Default Template from Locale' to use Ingenico ePayments extensions default template.

device_fingerprinting.label: Enable device fingerprinting
device_fingerprinting.comment: When enabling this, you still need to request the explicit consent of the customer in the checkout to transmit this data.
device_fingerprinting.tooltip: This functionality will transmit specific customer data as hash to Ingenico ePayments to identify the device from which the transaction was sent can be identified with the highest probability.

ops_rtimeout.label: Timeout for transactions
ops_rtimeout.comment: This value specifies the request timeout for that transaction. A value between 30 and 60 seconds is possible.

creditdebit_split.label: Credit/Debit card Split
creditdebit_split.tooltip: If activated an extra parameter is transmitted to Ingenico ePayments for the Creditcard/Debitcard payment methods.
creditdebit_split.comment: See also Ingenico ePayments documentation.

billing_day_month.label: Billing day for monthly subscriptions
billing_day_month.tooltip: Determines the day of the month when a monthly subscription gets triggered.

billing_day_week.label: Billing day for weekly subscriptions
billing_day_week.tooltip: Determines the day of the week when a weekly subscription gets triggered.

suspendSubscription_identity.label: Store contact responsible for subscription handling
suspendSubscription_identity.tooltip: This contact will receive the suspend/cancel requests for the subscriptions. See 'Store Email Adresses'.

suspendSubscription_template.label: E-Mail template for suspending/canceling a subscription
suspendSubscription_template.tooltip: This e-mail template is used for the automatically generated e-mail that is getting sent to the corresponding contact, if a customer wants to cancel a subscription.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

active_alias.label: Enabled Alias Manager
active_alias.comment: If this option is enabled, the customer's alias data will be saved in the shop. The data can then be used again later if the buyer has stored them permanently on Ingenico ePayments side.

image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

active.label: Enabled
active.comment: Make sure that gender and date of birth are required fields in the checkout. Otherwise this payment method will not be displayed.

allow_discounted_carts.label: Allow for discounted carts
allow_discounted_carts.comment: Allow payment method for discounted carts. Please note that not all aquirers support transmission of discount items.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

encoding.label: Request Data Encoding
encoding.comment: When using Klarna as your aquirer you will need to switch to the option 'Other'.
encoding.tooltip: When the option 'Other' is selected the request data will get converted to ASCII chararcters by using the appropriate transliterations for the given locale of the store.

show_invoice_terms.label: Show invoice terms link
show_invoice_terms.tooltip: Allows you to display a configurable link to your aquirers invoicing terms and conditions.

groups.ops_interSolve:
Ingenico ePayments InterSolve 170 1 1 1fkbc
Enabled select adminhtml/system_config_source_yesno 1 1 1 0
Title text 10 1 1 1 required-entry
Sort Order text 20 1 1 1
Payment from Applicable Countries allowspecific 30 adminhtml/system_config_source_payment_allspecificcountries 1 1 0
Payment from Specific Countries multiselect 40 adminhtml/system_config_source_country 1 1 0 1 1
Payment Logo 50 paymentLogo adminhtml/system_config_backend_image ops/paymentLogo ops/paymentLogo 1 1 1 Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.
Payment Logo Visibility 60 select ops/system_config_backend_paymentLogo 1 1 1
Brand ops/system_config_form_field_brand ops/system_config_backend_intersolve_brands 70 1 1 1 Add one or more brands. In field "BRAND" you will have to enter the value you got from Ingenico ePayments.

redirect_all.label: Enable redirect payment for all card types
redirect_all.comment: If set to Yes, customers will be redirected to the external Ingenico ePayments payment page.

inline_types.label: Enable inline payment (Direct Link) for these card types
inline_types.tooltip: For the selected card types, the customer can enter the credit card details directly in the checkout.

enabled_3dsecure.label: Enable 3D secure
enabled_3dsecure.tooltip: If the customer's credit card supports 3D Secure, he will be redirected to an external page to enter his password.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

backend_enabled.label: Enable for backend
backend_enabled.tooltip: This sets if this payment method should also be available for orders from the Magento backend.

active_alias.label: Enabled Alias Manager
active_alias.comment: If this option is enabled, the customer's alias data will be saved in the shop. The data can then be used again later if the buyer has stored them permanently on Ingenico ePayments side.

alias_usage_for_new_alias.label: Aliasusage New
alias_usage_for_new_alias.comment: Here you can enter the desired text which will be displayed on Ingenico ePayments side.

alias_usage_for_existing_alias.label: Aliasusage existing Alias
alias_usage_for_existing_alias.comment: Here you can enter the desired text which is used for existing alias, the text will be displayed on Ingenico ePayments side.

zero_amount_checkout.label: Allow zero amount authorization
zero_amount_checkout.comment: Only if payment action is authorize.

redirect_all.label: Enable redirect payment for all card types
redirect_all.comment: If set to Yes, customers will be redirected to the external Ingenico ePayments payment page.

inline_types.label: Enable inline payment (Direct Link) for these card types
inline_types.tooltip: For the selected card types, the customer can enter the credit card details directly in the checkout.

enabled_3dsecure.label: Enable 3D secure
enabled_3dsecure.tooltip: If the customer's credit card supports 3D Secure, he will be redirected to an external page to enter his password.

image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

backend_enabled.tooltip: This sets if this payment method should also be available for orders from the Magento backend.

alias_usage_for_new_alias.label: Aliasusage New
alias_usage_for_new_alias.comment: Here you can enter the desired text which will be displayed on Ingenico ePayments side.

alias_usage_for_existing_alias.label: Aliasusage existing Alias
alias_usage_for_existing_alias.comment: Here you can enter the desired text which is used for existing alias, the text will be displayed on Ingenico ePayments side.

show_alias_manager_info_for_guests.label: Show Alias Manager information for guests

zero_amount_checkout.label: Allow zero amount authorization
zero_amount_checkout.comment: Only if payment action is authorize.

default.label: Show empty default option
default.tooltip: A generic option, that lets the customer choose the exact method on Ingenico ePayments side.

default_title.label: Default option title
default_title.tooltip: Title to display for the default option.

methods.label: Methods
methods.comment: Add one or more methods. In field 'PM' you will have to enter the PM value you got from Ingenico ePayments, same goes for the field 'BRAND'.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

title.label: Title
title.comment: This payment method always uses direct sale as payment action.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

ops_recurring_cc.label: Ingenico ePayments Subscription Manager via Cc

active.label: Enabled
active.comment: To use this functionality you have to have the Subscription manager function enabled in the Ingenico ePayments backend.
active.tooltip: This payment method is used to handle subscriptions via Ingenico ePayments through Magentos recurring profiles. It is only available for orders containing only nominal items.

enabled_3dsecure.label: Enable 3D secure
enabled_3dsecure.tooltip: If the customer's credit card supports 3D Secure, he will be redirected to an external page to enter his password.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

image.label: Payment Logo
image.comment: Allowed file types: jpeg, gif, png.

payPerMail_template.label: PayPerMail Email Template
payPerMail_template.tooltip: The email template to use. Choose 'Default Template from Locale' to use Ingenico ePayments extensions default template.
